image.altText: A whale in the water as a fishing vessel approaches

props.synopsis: Two humpback whales were found dead in krill fishing nets near Antarctica earlier this year, while a third whale had serious injuries, a report from a conservation conference in Hobart has revealed.

title.children: 'Distressing': Dead and injured humpback whales found in krill fishing nets near Antarctica

image.altText: Helen Bird smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Helen Bird's friends never believed she would take her own life, leaving behind her three children. Fourteen years later, a coroner rules her husband made her death look like a suicide.

title.children: Coroner finds husband 'was involved' in wife's death, 14 years after it was deemed a 'suicide'

image.altText: A caramel coloured mother labradoodle feeding her puppies.

props.synopsis: Whistleblowers who told the RSPCA about conditions at a now-shut Tasmanian labradoodle breeding facility say they are in fear of being prosecuted themselves, with the animal welfare group announcing a review into possible charges.

title.children: RSPCA seeks to pursue whistleblowers who came forward about conditions at Tasmanian Labradoodles

image.altText: a painted depiction of John Batman meeting with Kulin leaders at Merri Creek

props.synopsis: While the legacy of John Batman's 1835 treaty with Kulin elders is contested, the story of the violent entrepreneur who tried to bargain with Melbourne's Aboriginal owners is a defining moment in Victoria's colonial history.

title.children: In 1835, Tasmanian grazier John Batman attempted to make a treaty with Melbourne's Aboriginal owners. Here's what happened

image.altText: People playing pokie machines at the Cherokee Casino in Siloam Spring,

props.synopsis: The man behind Tasmania's promised cashless gaming card says the "backbone of every MP is under pressure" due to a concerted campaign against it by the state's hospitality lobby.

title.children: MPs under pressure from gambling lobby over harm minimisation plan, Liberal MP claims

image.altText: Female basketball players embrace, seen from behind.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's championship team wants to establish a professional women's team in either the north or north-west, as it looks to expand into the state's basketball heartland.

title.children: 'The north deserves it': JackJumpers plan women's team expansion to either Launceston or Devonport

image.altText: Side on view of a horde of swimmers rushing into water.

props.synopsis: After a more muted affair this year, the organisers of the iconic Dark Mofo festival in Tasmania are ready to make their return in 2025. Here's what people can expect.

title.children: Dark Mofo organisers prepare to 'bathe the city in red' with event's full return in Hobart in 2025

image.altText: A close-up photograph of Ricardo Barbaro, a man with short dark hair and a neat beard.

props.synopsis: Ricardo Barbaro stabbed 26-year-old mother Ellie Price in her South Melbourne apartment before fleeing interstate.

title.children: Melbourne man who stabbed Tasmanian mum Ellie Price to death jailed for 28 years

image.altText: Mark stands looking at camera with photo of him and his late wife, Kathleen

props.synopsis: With asbestos lurking in an estimated one-third of Australian homes, campaigners want compulsory registers of the deadly product for home owners in an effort to save the lives of unsuspecting renovators.

title.children: Families call for asbestos action, with teenager, home renovator among those to contract mesothelioma

image.altText: A generic stock photo of a woman hunched over a Macbook and some notepads, looking stressed.

props.synopsis: In the era of workers quiet quitting, demanding their right to disconnect and working from home — how can work addiction be "one of the most important challenges in organisational psychology and public health in the 21st century"?

title.children: The picture that emerges from new workplace data is of a profoundly unsatisfying work culture

image.altText: submarine in ocean half above the water

props.synopsis: The Australian Navy has been left with just one fully operational submarine as the rest of its aging Collins-class fleet undergoes urgent repairs or await upgrades. Defence sources have confirmed to the ABC two of the Collins submarines are currently stationed in Adelaide, where there are delays to maintenance.

title.children: The Australian Navy has been left with just one fully operational submarine

image.altText: Donald Trump scowls as he stands in front of yellow flouncy curtains.

props.synopsis: What happened in Wayne County could play out again in key swing states this election.

title.children: In 2020, election board officials certified the Michigan result for Joe Biden. Then they got a call from Donald Trump himself

image.altText: A montage including images of Lachlan Murdoch, Rupert Murdoch and black and white chess pieces.

props.synopsis: Rupert Murdoch has been a kingmaker around the world for decades but, as Americans prepare to got to the polls, it's another election that has backed News Corp into a corner.

title.children: News Corp continues the fight against democracy

image.altText: A man walks through stacked rows of cheese wheels.

props.synopsis: When a French supermarket placed an order at Neal's Yard Dairy worth almost $600,000, it seemed too good to be true — and it was.

title.children: Man arrested over London's 'great cheese heist' but 22 tonnes of cheddar still missing

image.altText: Police cars and an ambulance on a street where a couple of people can be seen.

props.synopsis: A man has died after being found with a gunshot wound in North Melbourne on Saturday morning.

title.children: Man dead after 'horrific' shooting in Melbourne's inner north

image.altText: Cars are strewn on top of each other in a pile in a tunnel, with emergency workers standing in knee-deep water nearby

props.synopsis: An Australian English teacher in Spain describes seeing cars and trees "flying around" as floodwaters tear though Valencia in Spain, leaving scenes similar to a war zone.

title.children: 'It's just out of this world': Australian caught in Spanish floods recounts 'apocalypse' as number killed passes 200

image.altText: A squirrel being held be a human hand while it wears a cowboy hat.

props.synopsis: According to city officials, the squirrel was possessed illegally, and had been euthanised to test for rabies, but not before it bit a government staffer.

title.children: Instagram famous squirrel named Peanut euthanised by New York authorities

image.altText: A rescue worker in high visibility clothing climbing over a collapsed roof.

props.synopsis: Authorities face an "extremely difficult rescue operation" as they work to find people trapped underneath rubble.

title.children: At least 13 killed as roof of Serbian train station collapses

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Victoria Police raid a Wimmera property and seize 10 tonnes of chemicals, which they allege were due to be turned into methylamphetamine.

title.children: Police seize $500 million worth of methylamphetamine chemicals from rural Victorian property

image.altText: A photo of P Diddy at the Met Gala wearing a black and white stripped suit

props.synopsis: He was a giant on the American music scene, but Sean "Diddy" Combs is facing more than two dozen lawsuits for sexual abuse. Here's a breakdown.

title.children: The lawsuits and charges filed against Sean 'Diddy' Combs

image.altText: A flock of sheep on an outback station.

props.synopsis: Billionaire Andrew "Twiggy" Forrest has withdrawn from a bid to transform Australia's largest sheep station into a green energy hub, blaming delays in government approval.

title.children: Andrew 'Twiggy' Forrest withdraws from renewable energy takeover of nation's largest sheep station

image.altText: A jogger runs along the shore of Manly Beach after sunrise on the first day of Spring in Sydney, 2008

props.synopsis: Australia's Pilbara region has been heating up, with temperatures soaring past 43C this week. The hot air is now starting to travel to the south-east, bringing along with it a heightened risk of fires.

title.children: BOM is predicting a hot weekend. This is where the temperatures are expected to rise the most

image.altText: A close up of a shiny red quandong fruit growing on a tree

props.synopsis: Quandongs fetch high prices but overcoming inconsistent supply remains a challenge to growing a market.

title.children: Fruit retailing at $100 per kilo has huge demand but farmers are struggling to grow them

image.altText: Jeffrey Guan posing for a photo after being blinded in one eye

props.synopsis: Jeffrey Guan required emergency surgery in Canberra after suffering a serious fracture to his left cheekbone and eye socket when struck by a ball during a NSW Open regional qualifying pro-am on September 20.

title.children: Golf prodigy vows to not give up on dreams after being blinded by freak on-course hit

image.altText: owners of Thai Rock restaurant Stephanie and David Boyd look at the camera inside their eatery

props.synopsis: The owners of the Western Sydney eatery forced to close due to one of the first COVID-19 clusters say they would again listen to the government advice.

title.children: ‘Still brings tears to my eyes’: The restaurant that was ground zero for one of Sydney’s first COVID clusters

image.altText: gaza strike

props.synopsis: The heads of several United Nations organisations have urged all sides to immediately cease fighting in the war-torn Middle East, expressing alarm about the welfare of civilians living in North Gaza.

title.children: UN warns entire North Gaza population at 'imminent risk' of death

image.altText: An old black and white photo of three rows of boys in team photo with white shorts and black jumpers.

props.synopsis: Since his first kick in the under-15s in 1946, Brian Millett has been a Brigades man through and through for eight decades.

title.children: Brian was 13 when he first he first kicked a footy for his club. At 91, he is still going strong

image.altText: Family with parents, three kids sitting on sand dunes at beach

props.synopsis: A WA father estimates he and his wife have spent about $60,000 on diagnoses, treatment, and medication for their three children with ADHD and autism.

title.children: High fees, long waiting lists leave parents spending thousands on ADHD treatment for kids

image.altText: A rectangular baking tray with spiced chicken thighs roasted on top of lentils. It's topped with dill and lemon wedges.

props.synopsis: Juicy charred chicken bakes on top of creamy tinned lentils in an easy meal that leaves very little washing up.

title.children: A chicken and lentil tray bake with just 10 minutes of prep

image.altText: Aunty Pegg

props.synopsis: First Nations people across Queensland are reacting to the new government's stand on truth-telling.

title.children: 'Very well proportioned for 15': The disturbing records on Queenslanders who won’t get the inquiry they were promised

image.altText: A man smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Despite launching the biggest door knocking campaign in any state or territory, the Greens are expected to lose their inner-city seat of South Brisbane and went backwards in its other nearby seat of Maiwar.

title.children: Strategist says Greens losing older millennial voters as MP vows to listen after Queensland election result

image.altText: A young girl is sitting on a hospital bed with her legs crossed. Her hair is disheveled and

props.synopsis: A senior police officer told AFP a police van transporting personnel to protect polio staff was hit in the attack.

title.children: Motorcycle bomb targeting vaccination team in Pakistan kills seven, including five children

image.altText: A small, pink car called a Mini Moke with eyelashes extending from the headlights.

props.synopsis: With their bright colours, soft tops and eye-catching designs, Mini Mokes are instantly recognisable.

title.children: Decades after Mini Mokes were last made, they're still turning heads
